intro: Pentagonia donnell-smithii, commonly known as the Donnell-Smith pentagonia, is a rare flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive pentagonal-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
